senses.ex: She has multiple tasks to complete.

Tips.title: Quantity Indication
Tips.description: Use 'multiple' to indicate that there's more than one item, often without specifying how many.
Tips.example: She bought multiple dresses for the event.

Tips.title: Indefinite Quantity
Tips.description: 'Multiple' suggests several items but not a large quantity like 'many' would.
Tips.example: He checked the document multiple times.

senses.de: A number that can be divided by another number without leaving a remainder.

Tips.title: Division Clarity
Tips.description: Use 'multiple' in math to show clear division without any remainder.

Tips.title: Multiplication Connection
Tips.description: Remember 'multiple' comes from 'multiply'. A multiple is the result of multiplying.
Tips.example: The multiples of 3 start with 3, 6, 9, and so on.

senses.de: A financial term for the ratio of a company's market value to its earnings.
senses.ex: The company's price/earnings multiple is very high.

Tips.title: Financial Ratio
Tips.description: In finance, 'multiple' measures value; it's not about quantity but comparison.
Tips.example: Investors examined the sales multiple to assess growth.

Tips.title: Market Evaluation
Tips.description: A 'multiple' in finance often refers to how the market values a company compared to its earnings.
Tips.example: They discussed the earnings multiple during the presentation.

senses.de: Being or happening in more ways than one.
senses.ex: There are multiple theories about the origin of life.

Tips.title: Variety of Ways
Tips.description: As an adjective, 'multiple' can mean there are various forms or methods involved.

Tips.title: Different Angles
Tips.description: Indicate the presence of diverse perspectives or possibilities beyond the obvious one.
Tips.example: Her symptoms could have multiple causes.

senses.de: An electrical device for making multiple electrical connections.
senses.ex: Use a multiple to connect these wires.

Tips.title: Connection Device
Tips.description: In technical contexts, a 'multiple' makes several connections within one device.
Tips.example: The electrician used a multiple for the complex wiring.

Tips.title: Simplifying Complexity
Tips.description: A 'multiple' in engineering can simplify systems by combining connections.
Tips.example: The new circuit design includes a multiple for efficiency.

Abundant.wordDefinition:
Abundant means having a large amount of something, whereas the word multiple means having several or many of something.

For example, if you have an abundant supply of food, it means you have a lot of it, whereas if you have multiple choices for dinner, it means you have several options to choose from.

Abundant is applicable in situations where there is a large quantity of something, such as an abundant supply of water during a rainy season, or an abundant number of fruits during harvest time.

Diverse.wordDefinition:
Diverse means having a variety of different things or people. It's used to describe a group of things or people that are different from each other in some way, for example, a diverse group of friends from different backgrounds.

So basically, diverse means different and varied, while multiple means many of the same thing. Diverse is more commonly used to describe people or groups, while multiple is more commonly used to describe things or parts.

Many.wordDefinition:
Many means a large number of something or a number that is difficult to count, while multiple means more than one or occurring several times.

For example, many people attended the concert, but the band played multiple encores.

Many can be used when talking about a number of things that are distinct or not necessarily related, while multiple is used when referring to a repeated or connected set of things.

Many describes a quantity, while multiple describes a relationship.

Multitudinous.wordDefinition:
Multiple refers to having several or many of something, while multitudinous means having a very large number or multitude of something.

A multitudinous crowd would suggest a massive number of people gathered in one place.

Multiple describes a moderate number of things, while multitudinous implies an overwhelmingly large quantity.

Numerous.wordDefinition:
Both words, multiple and numerous refer to quantity, but there is a subtle difference between them.

Numerous refers to a large number of things or people, without necessarily indicating any specific multiple. It means there is a great quantity, amount or number of something.

If you say "there are numerous books on the shelf", it means there are a lot of books, and the number may be quite large.

Multiple refers to a specific quantitative relationship and numerous refers to a general sense of abundance or large quantity.

Plural.wordDefinition:
Plural refers to the state of there being more than one of something. For example, if there are two dogs, we would say "the dogs are plural".

Multiple also means "more than one," but it implies a greater quantity than plural. For example, if there are five dogs, we could say "the dogs are multiple".

Plural describes when there is more than one of something, while multiple describes a larger quantity of that same thing.

Several.wordDefinition:
Several means a few or a small number, and it is typically used when referring to a limited or specific number of things or instances.

For instance, the sentence "I invited several friends to my birthday party" means that the speaker invited a few friends, but not a large group.

If you want to convey a large number of things, use multiple, but if you want to refer to a specific number or a limited amount, use 'several.'

Various.wordDefinition:
Both multiple and various refer to having more than one item or type of something.

However, multiple is used to indicate a specific number of instances or repetitions of something, while various implies a range or diversity of items or types.

If someone says they have various hobbies, they are indicating that they have a range of interests, such as playing sports, reading books, and listening to music.

Multiple is used when referring to a specific number or quantity of something, while various is used when referring to a range or diversity of something.

quotes.Text: Treat everyone with the same respect that you want to be treated with. That's going to take a collective group of people to do it. There's not one individual that's going to change it. It's going to take multiple people getting out, learning who each other are and loving each other no matter what their political views or what their background is.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: George Hill

quotes.Text: I was having multiple surgeries after fights and not really addressing them the way I should have and having a proper off-season. So it was leading to more injuries and really making a strong influence on the way I was fighting. I was having to fight around injuries and not fight because it was the most efficient technique to use.
quotes.Title: American Mixed Martial Artist
quotes.Name: Frank Mir

quotes.Text: There's multiple ways I express myself. Music is my first love and will always come first. But, there are other areas and industries I'm interested in that reflect different aspects of my lifestyle.

quotes.Name: G-Eazy

quotes.Text: Any charity that aids or supports trying to find a cure for cancer is very close to my heart. My mom had cancer multiple times, so it's something that I can relate to.

quotes.Text: The fun is getting to wear multiple disguises and getting to explore multiple personalities and bring them to life. So a movie career definitely affords me that.

quotes.Text: I love 'Trading Places,' but 'Coming to America' has one of the things I like to do - I like the multiple characters.
